pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhagavā bhikkhūnaṃ anekapariyāyena vinayakathaṃ katheti, vinayassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, vinayapariyattiyā vaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, ādissa ādissa āyasmato upālissa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:1.2.eng: At that time the Buddha gave many talks about the Monastic Law, spoke in praise of the Monastic Law and of learning the Monastic Law, and repeatedly praised Venerable Upāli.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:1.3.eng: When the monks heard this, they thought,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:1.4.pli: “bhagavā kho anekapariyāyena vinayakathaṃ katheti, vinayassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, vinayapariyattiyā vaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, ādissa ādissa āyasmato upālissa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsati.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:1.5.pli: Handa mayaṃ, āvuso, āyasmato upālissa santike vinayaṃ pariyāpuṇāmā”ti, te ca bahū bhikkhū therā ca navā ca majjhimā ca āyasmato upālissa santike vinayaṃ pariyāpuṇanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:1.5.eng: “Well then, let’s learn the Monastic Law from Venerable Upāli.” And many monks, both senior and junior, as well as those of middle standing, learned the Monastic Law from Upāli.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:1.6.eng: The monks from the group of six

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:1.7.pli: “etarahi kho, āvuso, bahū bhikkhū therā ca navā ca majjhimā ca āyasmato upālissa santike vinayaṃ pariyāpuṇanti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:1.8.pli: Sace ime vinaye pakataññuno bhavissanti amhe yenicchakaṃ yadicchakaṃ yāvadicchakaṃ ākaḍḍhissanti parikaḍḍhissanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:1.8.eng: “If these monks become well-versed in the Monastic Law, they’ll boss us around as they like.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:1.9.eng: So let’s disparage the Monastic Law.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:1.10.pli: Atha kho chabbaggiyā bhikkhū bhikkhū upasaṅkamitvā evaṃ vadanti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:1.10.eng: They went to the other monks and said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:1.11.pli: “kiṃ panimehi khuddānukhuddakehi sikkhāpadehi uddiṭṭhehi, yāvadeva kukkuccāya vihesāya vilekhāya saṃvattantī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:1.11.eng: “What’s the point of reciting these minor training rules, when they just lead to anxiety, oppression, and annoyance?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:1.12.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:1.12.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:1.13.eng: “How can the monks from the group of six disparage the Monastic Law?” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:1.14.eng: “Is it true, monks, that you do this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:1.17.pli: kathañhi nāma tumhe, moghapurisā, vinayaṃ vivaṇṇessatha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:1.17.eng: “Foolish men, how can you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:1.19.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:1.19.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:1.20.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu pātimokkhe uddissamāne evaṃ vadeyya—‘kiṃ panimehi khuddānukhuddakehi sikkhāpadehi uddiṭṭhehi, yāvadeva kukkuccāya vihesāya vilekhāya saṃvattantī’ti, sikkhāpadavivaṇṇake pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:1.20.1.eng: ‘When the Monastic Code is being recited, if a monk says, “What’s the point of reciting these minor training rules, when they just lead to anxiety, oppression, and annoyance?” then in disparaging the training rules, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:2.1.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:2.1.5.eng: When the Monastic Code is being recited:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:2.1.6.pli: uddisante vā uddisāpente vā sajjhāyaṃ vā karonte.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:2.1.6.eng: when reciting it, when having it recited, or when practicing it.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:2.1.8.pli: “kiṃ panimehi khuddānukhuddakehi sikkhāpadehi uddiṭṭhehi, yāvadeva kukkuccāya vihesāya vilekhāya saṃvattantī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:2.1.8.eng: “What’s the point of reciting these minor training rules, when they just lead to anxiety, oppression, and annoyance?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:2.1.9.pli: “Ye imaṃ pariyāpuṇanti tesaṃ kukkuccaṃ hoti, vihesā hoti, vilekhā hoti, ye imaṃ na pariyāpuṇanti tesaṃ kukkuccaṃ na hoti vihesā na hoti vilekhā na hoti. Anuddiṭṭhaṃ idaṃ varaṃ, anuggahitaṃ idaṃ varaṃ, apariyāpuṭaṃ idaṃ varaṃ, adhāritaṃ idaṃ varaṃ, vinayo vā antaradhāyatu, ime vā bhikkhū appakataññuno hontū”ti upasampannassa vinayaṃ vivaṇṇeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:2.1.9.eng: If he disparages the Monastic Law to one who is fully ordained, saying, “Those who learn this will be anxious,” “They will feel oppressed,” “They will be annoyed;” “Those who don’t learn this won’t be anxious,” “They won’t feel oppressed,” “They won’t be annoyed;” “It’s better left unrecited,” “It’s better left unlearned,” “It’s better left unstudied,” “It’s better left unmastered;” “May the Monastic Law disappear, or may these monks remain ignorant,” then he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:2.2.1.pli: Upasampanne upasampannasaññī vinayaṃ vivaṇṇeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:2.2.1.eng: If he disparages the Monastic Law to one who is fully ordained, and he perceives them as fully ordained, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:2.2.2.pli: Upasampanne vematiko vinayaṃ vivaṇṇeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:2.2.2.eng: If he disparages the Monastic Law to one who is fully ordained, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:2.2.3.pli: Upasampanne anupasampannasaññī vinayaṃ vivaṇṇeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:2.2.3.eng: If he disparages the Monastic Law to one who is fully ordained, but he does not perceive them as fully ordained, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:2.2.4.eng: If he disparages some other rule, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:2.2.5.pli: Anupasampannassa vinayaṃ vā aññaṃ vā dhammaṃ vivaṇṇeti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:2.2.5.eng: If he disparages the Monastic Law or some other rule to one who is not fully ordained, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:2.2.6.eng: If it is to one who is not fully ordained, but he perceives them as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:2.2.7.eng: If it is to one who is not fully ordained, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:2.2.8.eng: If it is to one who is not fully ordained, and he does not perceive them as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:2.3.2.pli: na vivaṇṇetukāmo, “iṅgha tvaṃ suttante vā gāthāyo vā abhidhammaṃ vā pariyāpuṇassu, pacchā vinayaṃ pariyāpuṇissasī”ti bhaṇati,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:2.3.2.eng: if, not desiring to disparage, he says, “Listen, learn discourses or verses or philosophy, and later you can learn the Monastic Law;”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:2.3.4.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:2.3.5.eng: The training rule on annoyance, the second, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc73:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc73:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc73:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc73:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū anācāraṃ ācaritvā “aññāṇakena āpannāti jānantū”ti pātimokkhe uddissamāne evaṃ vadanti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc73:1.2.eng: the monks from the group of six were misbehaving. They said to each other, “Let’s make the other monks think that we committed these offenses because we didn’t know the rules.” Then, during the recitation of the Monastic Code, they said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc73:1.3.pli: “idāneva kho mayaṃ jānāma, ayampi kira dhammo suttāgato suttapariyāpanno anvaddhamāsaṃ uddesaṃ āgacchatī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc73:1.3.eng: “Only now did we find out that this rule too is included in the Monastic Code and comes up for recitation every half-month.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc73:1.4.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc73:1.4.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc73:1.5.pli: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhū pātimokkhe uddissamāne evaṃ vakkhanti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc73:1.5.eng: “How could the monks from the group of six say this during the recitation of the Monastic Code?” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc73:1.6.pli: ‘idāneva kho mayaṃ jānāma, ayampi kira dhammo suttāgato suttapariyāpanno anvaddhamāsaṃ uddesaṃ āgacchatī’”ti …pe…

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc73:1.7.pli: “saccaṃ kira tumhe, bhikkhave, pātimokkhe uddissamāne evaṃ vadetha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc73:1.7.eng: “Is it true, monks, that you said this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc73:1.8.pli: ‘idāneva kho mayaṃ jānāma, ayampi kira dhammo suttāgato suttapariyāpanno anvaddhamāsaṃ uddesaṃ āgacchatī’”ti?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc73:1.11.pli: kathañhi nāma tumhe, moghapurisā, pātimokkhe uddissamāne evaṃ vakkhatha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc73:1.11.eng: “Foolish men, how could you say this during the recitation of the Monastic Code?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc73:1.12.pli: ‘idāneva kho mayaṃ jānāma, ayampi kira dhammo suttāgato suttapariyāpanno anvaddhamāsaṃ uddesaṃ āgacchatī’ti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc73:1.14.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc73:1.14.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc73:1.15.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu anvaddhamāsaṃ pātimokkhe uddissamāne evaṃ vadeyya—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc73:1.15.1.eng: ‘During the half-monthly recitation of the Monastic Code, a monk might say,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc73:1.16.pli: ‘idāneva kho ahaṃ jānāmi, ayampi kira dhammo suttāgato suttapariyāpanno anvaddhamāsaṃ uddesaṃ āgacchatī’ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc73:1.16.eng: “Only now did I find out that this rule too has come down in the Monastic Code, is included in the Monastic Code, and comes up for recitation every half-month.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc73:1.17.pli: Tañce bhikkhuṃ aññe bhikkhū jāneyyuṃ nisinnapubbaṃ iminā bhikkhunā dvattikkhattuṃ pātimokkhe uddissamāne, ko pana vādo bhiyyo, na ca tassa bhikkhuno aññāṇakena mutti atthi, yañca tattha āpattiṃ āpanno tañca yathādhammo kāretabbo, uttari cassa moho āropetabbo—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc73:1.17.eng: If other monks know that that monk has previously sat through at least two or three recitations of the Monastic Code, then that monk is not let off because of ignorance, and he is to be dealt with according to the rule. Further, he should be charged with deception:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc73:1.18.pli: ‘tassa te, āvuso, alābhā, tassa te dulladdhaṃ, yaṃ tvaṃ pātimokkhe uddissamāne na sādhukaṃ aṭṭhiṃ katvā manasi karosī’ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc73:1.18.eng: “It’s a loss for you that you don’t pay proper attention during the recitation of the Monastic Code.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc73:1.19.eng: And for the act of deception, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc73:2.1.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc73:2.1.7.eng: During the recitation of the Monastic Code:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc73:2.1.11.pli: “aññāṇakena āpannoti jānantū”ti pātimokkhe uddissamāne evaṃ vadeti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc73:2.1.11.eng: “Let them think that I committed these offenses because I didn’t know the rules.” If, during the recitation of the Monastic Code, he then says,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc73:2.1.12.pli: “idāneva kho ahaṃ jānāmi, ayampi kira dhammo suttāgato suttapariyāpanno anvaddhamāsaṃ uddesaṃ āgacchatī”ti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc73:2.1.12.eng: “Only now did I find out that this rule too has come down in the Monastic Code, is included in the Monastic Code, and comes up for recitation every half-month,” then he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc73:2.1.13.pli: Tañce mohetukāmaṃ bhikkhuṃ aññe bhikkhū jāneyyuṃ nisinnapubbaṃ iminā bhikkhunā dvattikkhattuṃ pātimokkhe uddissamāne, ko pana vādo bhiyyo, na ca tassa bhikkhuno aññāṇakena mutti atthi, yañca tattha āpattiṃ āpanno, tañca yathādhammo kāretabbo, uttari cassa moho āropetabbo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc73:2.1.13.eng: If other monks know that the monk who wants to deceive has previously sat through at least two or three recitations of the Monastic Code, then that monk is not let off because of ignorance, and he is to be dealt with according to the rule. Further, he should be charged with deception.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc73:2.1.14.eng: “And, monks, he is to be charged like this.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc73:2.1.15.eng: A competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc73:2.1.16.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc73:2.1.17.pli: Ayaṃ itthannāmo bhikkhu pātimokkhe uddissamāne na sādhukaṃ aṭṭhiṃ katvā manasi karoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc73:2.1.17.eng: Monk so-and-so did not pay proper attention during the recitation of the Monastic Code.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc73:2.1.18.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho itthannāmassa bhikkhuno mohaṃ āropeyya.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc73:2.1.18.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should charge him with deception.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc73:2.1.20.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc73:2.1.21.pli: Ayaṃ itthannāmo bhikkhu pātimokkhe uddissamāne na sādhukaṃ aṭṭhiṃ katvā manasi karoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc73:2.1.21.eng: Monk so-and-so did not pay proper attention during the recitation of the Monastic Code.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc73:2.1.22.eng: The Sangha charges him with deception.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc73:2.1.23.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati itthannāmassa bhikkhuno mohassa āropanā, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc73:2.1.23.eng: Any monk who approves of charging him with deception should remain silent.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc73:2.1.24.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc73:2.1.25.eng: The Sangha has charged monk so-and-so with deception.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc73:2.1.26.pli: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī’”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc73:2.1.26.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc73:2.1.27.eng: If he deceives, but he has not been charged with deception, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc73:2.1.28.eng: If he deceives, and he has been charged with deception, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc73:2.2.1.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, and he perceives it as legitimate, and he deceives, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc73:2.2.2.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but he is unsure of it, and he deceives, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc73:2.2.3.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but he perceives it as illegitimate, and he deceives, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc73:2.2.4.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but he perceives it as legitimate, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc73:2.2.5.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc73:2.2.6.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, and he perceives it as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc73:2.3.2.eng: if he has not heard it in full;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc73:2.3.3.eng: if he has heard it fewer than two or three times in full;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc73:2.3.4.eng: if he does not want to deceive;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc73:2.3.6.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc73:2.3.7.eng: The training rule on deception, the third, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:1.1.eng: At one time the when Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū kupitā anattamanā sattarasavaggiyānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ pahāraṃ denti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:1.2.eng: the monks from the group of six hit the monks from the group of seventeen in anger.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:1.6.pli: “Ime, āvuso, chabbaggiyā bhikkhū kupitā anattamanā amhākaṃ pahāraṃ dentī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:1.6.eng: and they told them what had happened.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:1.7.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:1.7.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:1.8.pli: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhū kupitā anattamanā bhikkhūnaṃ pahāraṃ dassantī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:1.8.eng: “How could the monks from the group of six hit other monks in anger?” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:1.9.pli: “saccaṃ kira tumhe, bhikkhave, kupitā anattamanā bhikkhūnaṃ pahāraṃ dethā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:1.9.eng: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:1.12.pli: kathañhi nāma tumhe, moghapurisā, kupitā anattamanā bhikkhūnaṃ pahāraṃ dassatha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:1.12.eng: “Foolish men, how could you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:1.14.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:1.14.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:1.15.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhussa kupito anattamano pahāraṃ dadeyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:1.15.1.eng: ‘If a monk hits a monk in anger, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:2.1.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:2.1.10.pli: kāyena vā kāyapaṭibaddhena vā nissaggiyena vā antamaso uppalapattenapi pahāraṃ deti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:2.1.10.eng: if he hits with his body, with anything connected to his body, or with anything released, even if just with a lotus leaf, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:2.2.1.pli: Upasampanne upasampannasaññī kupito anattamano pahāraṃ deti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:2.2.1.eng: If it is one who is fully ordained, and he perceives him as such, and he hits him in anger, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:2.2.2.pli: Upasampanne vematiko kupito anattamano pahāraṃ deti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:2.2.2.eng: If it is one who is fully ordained, but he is unsure of it, and he hits him in anger, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:2.2.3.pli: Upasampanne anupasampannasaññī kupito anattamano pahāraṃ deti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:2.2.3.eng: If it is one who is fully ordained, but he does not perceive him as such, and he hits him in anger, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:2.2.4.pli: Anupasampannassa kupito anattamano pahāraṃ deti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:2.2.4.eng: If he hits one who is not fully ordained in anger, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:2.2.5.eng: If it is one who is not fully ordained, but he perceives them as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:2.2.6.eng: If it is one who is not fully ordained, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:2.2.7.eng: If it is one who is not fully ordained, and he does not perceive them as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:2.3.4.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc74:2.3.5.eng: The training rule on hitting, the fourth, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc75:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc75:0.5.eng: 75. The training rule on raising a hand

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc75:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc75:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc75:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū kupitā anattamanā sattarasavaggiyānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ talasattikaṃ uggiranti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc75:1.2.eng: the monks from the group of six raised their hands in anger against the monks from the group of seventeen.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc75:1.3.eng: Expecting to be hit, they cried.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc75:1.6.pli: “Ime, āvuso, chabbaggiyā bhikkhū kupitā anattamanā amhākaṃ talasattikaṃ uggirantī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc75:1.6.eng: and they told them what had happened.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc75:1.7.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc75:1.7.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc75:1.8.pli: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhū kupitā anattamanā sattarasavaggiyānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ talasattikaṃ uggirissantī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc75:1.8.eng: “How could the monks from the group of six do this?” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc75:1.9.pli: “saccaṃ kira tumhe, bhikkhave, kupitā anattamanā sattarasavaggiyānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ talasattikaṃ uggirathā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc75:1.9.eng: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc75:1.12.pli: kathañhi nāma tumhe, moghapurisā, kupitā anattamanā sattarasavaggiyānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ talasattikaṃ uggirissatha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc75:1.12.eng: “Foolish men, how could you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc75:1.14.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc75:1.14.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc75:1.15.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhussa kupito anattamano talasattikaṃ uggireyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc75:1.15.1.eng: ‘If a monk raises a hand in anger against a monk, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc75:2.1.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc75:2.1.10.pli: kāyaṃ vā kāyapaṭibaddhaṃ vā antamaso uppalapattampi uccāreti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc75:2.1.10.eng: if he raises any part of his body or anything connected to his body, even if just a lotus leaf, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc75:2.1.10.comm: Kāyaṁ uccāreti literally means, “He raises the body,” but presumably it refers to any part of the body.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc75:2.2.1.pli: Upasampanne upasampannasaññī kupito anattamano talasattikaṃ uggirati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc75:2.2.1.eng: If it is one who is fully ordained, and he perceives him as such, and he raises a hand against him in anger, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc75:2.2.2.pli: Upasampanne vematiko kupito anattamano talasattikaṃ uggirati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc75:2.2.2.eng: If it is one who is fully ordained, but he is unsure of it, and he raises a hand against him in anger, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc75:2.2.3.pli: Upasampanne anupasampannasaññī kupito anattamano talasattikaṃ uggirati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc75:2.2.3.eng: If it is one who is fully ordained, but he does not perceive him as such, and he raises a hand against him in anger, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc75:2.2.4.pli: Anupasampannassa kupito anattamano talasattikaṃ uggirati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc75:2.2.4.eng: If he raises a hand in anger against one who is not fully ordained, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc75:2.2.5.eng: If it is one who is not fully ordained, but he perceives them as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc75:2.2.6.eng: If it is one who is not fully ordained, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc75:2.2.7.eng: If it is one who is not fully ordained, and he does not perceive them as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc75:2.2.9.eng: if he raises his hand in self-defense;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc75:2.2.11.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc75:2.2.12.eng: The training rule on raising a hand, the fifth, is finished.
